36772327.review:
Ubinota est un jeu simple au début mais qui va devenir, au fil des niveaux, de plus en plus ardu. Cette complexité des niveaux se fait ressentir par le fait qu'au début on est dans un monde avec des puzzles en 2D puis l'aspect profondeur va venir s'intercaler, par la suite le jeu offre d'autres aspects qui seront basés sur le poids, la stabilité, .... Ceux sont ces aspects qui rendent le jeu simple et complexe à la fois.

Mais cette difficulté ne va pas vous faire quitter le jeu, car il existe pour la plupart des stages plusieurs solutions possibles. Le jeu est même conçu pour vous faire rester car la BO est extrêment relaxante et, en aucun cas, même si vous ne passez pas le niveau vous pouvez vous détendre en l'écoutant. De plus, le scénario n'est pas seulement là pour vous conter ce qui se passe dans ce monde, mais il vous aide aussi dans le choix des peintures et de leurs effets.

Pour ce qui est du gameplay, le jeu est très facile de prise en main, il n'y a pas de temps imparti pour finir les puzzles.

En définitive, ce jeu est une perle. Il est très facile de compréhension ( scénario, gameplay). Il est beau  et il est pour tous les âges. Le temps de jeu est assez long ( environ une dizaine d'heures pour le finir intégralement voire plus en fonction du niveau du joueur).

N.B. : je suis un joueur moyen donc le temps de jeu est assez relatif.

29805760.review:
I am bad at reviews so here is just a quick thing. I wish I liked this game. Please note I played a couple more hours or so while offline so it is not reflected on my playtime.

Pros: 
+The concept behind the game is fun and cute (y'know, the clouds and block types).

Cons: 
-Not a fan of the overly cute aesthetic.
-Puzzles reset upon failed attempt, and the camera is also reset, making some puzzles just frustrating.
-Physics seems to give you different results when using the same solution.
-Ran terribly for me, at about 45fps normally for some reason while "cutscenes" chugged at a slow motion 23~ish fps
-"cutscenes" on some levels play each time you retry the level
-made me just want to play a better puzzle game

I'm honestly sorry I can't recommend this game.

29394147.review:
[h1]Nice physics based puzzle game in a soothing environment but with a broken achievement[/h1]

The game has no trading cards.
One broken achievement.
No cloud sync.
And the dev's have sortof abandoned the game.
But I really liked the game and I can see the devs put a lot of effort in making it. So I'll give it a positive review.


[b]Gameplay[/b]

The game video pretty much explains the gameplay.
There are floating cubes, pillars that come out of nowhere and magic paints.
The goal is to paint cubes in such a way that the houses are connected to the pillars by appropriate color of paint. Cubes that are not connected to the pillar would fall, unless they're supported somehow.
You're supposed to save the houses from falling that way.

And there are different types/colors of paints (each with different properties) that are introduced as the game progresses. Red painted cubes float by themselves. Painting two adjacent cubes blue glues them together and so on.
The difficulty level overall is medium I'd say. Some levels, you just look at them and they're solved. Some others might be complex or might need a different approach and you might spend an hour on them.
Sadly there aren't many Steam guides for this game atm. But they're good enough and there's still enough help online.

The music and the art give this very soothing peaceful appeal to the gameplay. Also Lucien is such an adorable kid :')


[b]Achievements[/b]

Out of the 46 achievements, I got 41 of those just normally completing the game.
Another 4 of them, n° challenges, were a piece of cake after that.
The last one, Challenge n°1, has been broken since a game update and requires editing a [url=http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=586969494]game file[/url].

29153838.review:
Windows

3d Puzzler, single player only.

Puzzlers, not a fan favourite of mine but still I do enjoy Majong or The Room, somehow? Like platformers, I can love or leave them, mostly love to leave them alone. Tetris was my first puzzler back in 90’s on a friend’s hand held Nintendo Game Boy. I sucked then and I still suck now!

Ubinota is a 3D environment Puzzler that puts you in the shoes of Lucien an apprentice painter! Lucien exists in a world where the people live in the sky on skyblocks. Unfortunately (or fortunately, seeing your a painter, who is going to be kept in employment for the rest of your life, unless you kill everyone) your skyblock properties are held together with paint and this said paint is drying out. The danger being that people’s properties are falling faster than the Mongolian stock market.

This is where you jump in and save the day. You paint key blocks to anchor them together and save your peoples homes from the plunge. I personally think that they should toss the paint and use araldite but hey, who am I to argue.

The whole affair is a simple point and click mouse interface with a sparse UI. You start off with one colour in your bucket, Blue (but I think its more sky blue). You are given instructions on how certain aspects of the game works, as you progress through each of the levels.  Each group of levels are separated into sectors or lands, which there being seven lands in total. You also gain other colours of paint along the way and each one having a different magical use (but I have no clue, as I still suck and am stuck on the last level of Land. GOD DAMN IT! Give me more paint or some liquid nails!!).

Not all of it is simple connect the dots stuff. Some of it will rely on brain power, a little thing called physics (You suck Newton, hope you choke on your apple!) and your magical paints to advance through each level. 

Being 3D, you have the ability to rotate and zoom in and out your game area, which you will need to do to make sure selected blocks are pasted together (can I just use wood glue?). The different colours will not stick to each other, so you need to make sure you use the right ones on offer for you puzzle to work. There are levels marked with a !, these are extra bonus levels that do not need to be completed to move on through the story.

The Graphics are simple hand drawn 3d cartoon spirits and back grounds, which I personal find uninspiring. Also some of the toon writing can be hard to read, and gives the feeling that you are a 5 year old (That’s it! I will get my grandson to solve this fraken level!). 

The background music was also a little lacking and for me, more annoying instead of soothing, so I just turned it off. Other environmental sounds were also run-of-the-mill, out-of-the-box bland. 

What story there is to the game, is a little sparse and feels glued on like an after thought (Or like the green paint, a little flabby).

Another annoying part of the game, is the mule kick that happens when you hit the big red button, to see if you have glued the right boxes together. This resulted in me loosing the level because the house alone fell off the boxes. In another level the kick made my set of blocks (painted red to help keep afloat) keel over like a slow sinking ship, it made me chuckle….. the first time, but after fifty times, I was not a happy camper! 

Ubinota is a puzzler that feels more aimed at children 5+ or adults who love toonish type games. The puzzles are good and will stretch your grey matter, once past the first group of levels. It won’t hook you up into hours of fun, the grandson alone knocked it over in an hour and a half (Grand pop give you red cordial and heaps of chocolate now) but it is a good bit of time wasting when you need a break from other things (and have zen on anger management).

Now that my review is done, I will mix that tin of Dulux with some epoxy resin and see if this works on my house, if not its back to the nail gun.

25613465.review:
A puzzle game as I like'em best, simple mechanics that still offer a lot of depth.

The floating, cubic islands are collapsing, and their houses are in danger of falling into the void, so as a painter, and with the help of a wizard, you'll be painting cubes using various colors of paint, to keep them still (or relatively so), using pillars as footing, and saving the people from their impending doom.  It's a very interesting gimmick that I've rarely seen, and you'll need to think of a certain pattern to paint the stage before pressing the red button, the moment of truth which makes the blocks fall, and hope that the houses are safe and thus completes the level.  As you progress through the game, you'll be unlocking said paints, which all act in a different way; blue and cyan keep the cubes still, red makes them float up, green sort of has elastic and loose properties, etc.

Like the greatest puzzle games of the time, the game uses these limited options and soon grows surprinsingly complex.  You don't always have access to all paints in a level, and you are always limited depending on it, so it leads to many various situations.  In a level, you'd have to make a blue platform holding the homes, then make two blue platforms bellow to catch it, in the other you'd have to make a blue platform again, but catch it using a carefully crafted array of green blocks, acting like a net.  The game also has a very good physics engine on the block and homes, which you also have to account for, so for example, you'd have to watch out so that one of the red blocks that support a platform doesn't lift up a side too much due to a lack of weight, and making the poor people fall off, or even have to use unpainted blocks to keep a bridge of blue blocks, over the void, still and safe.  Again, the creators managed to make very creative levels using limited resources.

If there are some things I would complain, is that the camera remains focused on a single point, you can't move it to the sides, only rotate it, so visibility can sometimes be a problem, and if you pushed the red button, but it didn't work, you can't go back and try to figure what you painted wrong, the game forces you to restart from scratch, painting everything again.  I can overlook these issues though, for the sake of enjoying the game, it's not that bad in the grand scheme of things.

The graphics are good.  I wouldn't say that the cutscenes are riveting, as the story is pretty childish and basic, there's even some running gag with Lucien being hungry all the time and eating paint.  The in-game art however, is pretty neat, it's colorful and cartoony, and there's a lot of neat paintings on the cubes, giving most levels a flair of their own.  Some of these drawings also take advantage of the perspective on the cubes to make a pretty damn cool picture.

I was pleasantly surprised by this puzzle game, so much that I would be interested for a sequel.  It uses limited options to its best, and the painting gimmick isn't something I've seen much as well.  Definitely pick it up if you're an avid fan of puzzles.

3D паззл с отчасти приятной графикой и анимацией. Время от времени фон может сливаться с белыми блоками, что сильно напрягает зрение, особенно когда застрял на каком-то уровне.

Многие пишут, что игра для детей- если бы я в детстве мог это с лёгкостью пройти, я бы уже стал мультимиллиардером.

Но в целом игра здоровская. Можно проверить насколько у вас тупой или умный ребёнок, кстати. Только, скорее всего, у игры для вас будут плохие новости :D

24109529.review:
[h1]REVIEW - Ubinota[/h1]

[b]Veröffentlichung:[/b] 2015

[b]Genre:[/b] Puzzle
[b]Singleplayer:[/b] Ja
[b]Multiplayer:[/b] Nein
[b]Engine:[/b] -
[b]Spielzeit:[/b] ~4 Stunden

[b]Steuerung:[/b] Tastatur & Maus

[b]Preis-Leistung:[/b] Mäßig

[b]FAZIT:[/b] [i]Ubinota[/i] ist für knapp 8€ zwar ein relativ teures, aber dafür auch stark unterschätztes Spiel. Die Stärken dieses Indie-Puzzle-Games liegen klar in der einzigartigen Grafik und dem neuartigen Spielprinzip. Der Spieler muss in 3-dimensionalen "Würfelwelten" kleine Kästchen anmalen, um stützenden Säulen mit den Häusern der Bewohner zu verbinden, um zu verhindern dass diese der Schwerkraft zum Opfer fallen. Mit fortschreitenden Leveln steigt auch der Schwierigkeitsgrad an, und zusätzliche Farben zum Verbinden verschiedener Haustypen erweitern das Spielgeschehen weiters.

23944357.review:
Some of the physics puzzle levels can be beaten by just doing the same thing over and over again because the physics engine is so poor.

One of the achievements was updated to be impossible without modifying the game's files.

I rarely see a game ask for admin privileges - I don't suspect foul play, but it irks me out every time.

There is no button to simply undo your puzzle solution attempt without wiping everything you just made. Why? It's not making figuring out the solution any harder, it's making it tedious to paint dozens of tiles again to try a solution with a slight variable.

Somehow even the story manages to piss me off because the main character is just trying to chew on everything including paint (he's hungry - that's the extent of his personality), and everyone else is a complete jerkwad who doesn't appreciate this kid doing this for them. Duh, of course it's meant for comedic purposes, but for me it's not funny, it's just slapping me in the face for having the audacity to play this thing in the first place. It's the game's characters genuinely treating me like trash for saving their lives.

And every time you fail, you hear the main character make the disappointed, bratty sound of your own ears excreting. You desperately try to hit the retry-button to stop him from making that sound but it's always too late. I ended up muting the entire game and listening to conspiracy theorists on YouTube. It was an improvement.

The game wasn't fun. It was challenging at times, but very repetitive.

23887039.review:

答えを知っても「なるほど！」ではなく「ふーん」となるだけで、納得がいかない事が多い。
理論だてて作られた問題ではなく、
物理演算で遊んでたら、たまたま出来ましたっていう問題が多いからだと思う。
そんな問題ばっかりだから、ブロックが少ない問題ならまだしも、ブロックが多い問題になると考えるだけ無駄というかやる気が湧かない。
正直最初はちょっとおもしろいと思ったけど、パズルゲームとしては微妙ですね。

22797473.review:
„Ubinota“ ist das Erstlingswerk vom Zwei-Mann-Studio Rotateam, das am 04. März 2015 auf Steam erschien. Es handelt sich dabei um ein 3D-Knobelspiel, bei dem die Rätsel frei beweglich sind.

In „Ubinota“ verschlägt es den Spieler in der Rolle des Malers Lucien in eine Welt, in der die Einwohner im Himmel leben. Genauer gesagt auf schwebenden Inseln, die aus Würfeln bestehen. Allerdings sind die Inseln so instabil, dass sie auseinanderzufallen drohen, und genau da kommt Lucien ins Spiel. Mit seiner magischen Farbe kann er die Würfel stabilisieren, wenn er diese mit der robusten Stütze verbindet. Beim Klick auf den Auslöser fallen dann alle nicht verbundenen Quadrate auf die Erde hinab, und wenn das Haus der Einwohner ebenfalls lose ist, dann ist der Level verloren.

So leicht, wie sich das Gameplay allerdings anfangs anhört, ist es bei Weitem nicht, denn dem kleinen Maler steht nur ein begrenzter Vorrat an Farbe zur Verfügung, und so muss der Spieler den effizientesten Weg erknobeln, um die Häuser zu retten. Die Story wird dabei nur in kleinen Zwischensequenzen (die gezeichnete Bilder sind) erzählt und dient eigentlich nur als Mittel zum Zweck um ihm neue Farben zu geben.

Insgesamt gibt es sieben Welten mit über 100 Levels, wobei der Schwierigkeitsgrad allmählich ansteigt. Wo man anfangs nur eine Farbe benutzt und recht einfache Abschnitte meistert, kommen im späteren Verlauf weitere Farben hinzu, die unterschiedliche Attribute besitzen. Die rote Farbe beispielsweise bewirkt, dass Würfel selbstständig schweben; die grüne Farbe ist recht instabil, was dafür sorgt, dass die Würfel immer noch etwas nachgeben; und die gelbe Farbe zum Beispiel breitet sich eigenständig weiter aus.

Daduch werden die Rätsel später angenehm komplex und fordernd, allerdings gibt es soetwas wie Hilfe nicht. Zum Glück gibts aber die Community Guides, dort kann man im Notfall nachschauen.

Die Steuerung mit der Maus, egal, ob bei dem Anmalen der Würfel, der Entnahme der Farben oder dem freien Drehen der Konstruktionen, funktioniert präzise. Grafisch kann „Ubinota“ mit handgezeichneten Umgebungen punkten, wobei auf den Würfeln selbst häufig auch schöne Zeichnungen von Pflanzen oder Tieren abgebildet sind. 

Allgemein entsteht eine ruhige Rätselstimmung ohne Zeitdruck, was durch den sehr subtilen Soundtrack verstärkt wird.   Eine deutsche Version des Spiels gibt es nicht, was allerdings beim Rätseln selbst nicht stört, da man hier bis auf die Tutorials nichts lesen muss. 

Von mir gibt es deswegen für den geringen Preis von 7.99€ eine klare Kaufempfehlung!

21949394.review:
Gry logiczne to nie mój gatunek i zazwyczaj od nich stronię. Ubinotę zainstalowałem w przekonaniu, że pewnie przejdę jak zwykle kilka plansz i dam sobie spokój. Ku mojemu zdziwieniu wciągnęła mnie tak, że przeszedłem ją niemal na 2 posiedzenia. 

Gra polega na budowaniu fundamentów dla podniebnych domków. Robimy to... malując. Niepokolorowane bloki po prostu spadają w dół. Naszym zadaniem jest połączyć domek z kolumną zapewniającą stabilność konstrukcji. Prosty koncept, spora frajda. Jest w tym nawet fabuła. Humorystyczna, choć w sumie guzik mnie obchodziła.

Przede wszystkim nie jest to jedna z tych gier logicznych, gdzie po kilkunastu etapach poziom przekombinowania zaczyna frustrować. Tutaj kluczem do sukcesu jest nasza wyobraźnia. Każda plansza to jakiś konkretny pomysł, a gracz ma go po prostu dostrzec. Dopiero pod koniec zdarzały się etapy, które trzeba było przechodzić metodą prób i błędów, jednak można je policzyć na palcach jednej ręki.

Niemałą zaletą jest też grafika. Prosta, ale estetyczna i miła dla oka.

Większych wad właściwie nie dostrzegam. Lekki niesmak ze względu na niemożliwe do zdobycia osiągnięcie "Challenge n°1".

7/10

21856844.review:
这是一个益智游戏，通过给砖块涂颜色来保证小房子不会掉下去。
相同颜色的砖块相邻可以成为一个整体固定住，开始的关卡很简单，你只需要涂一种或两种颜色就够了，如果耐心玩下去，就会发现后面的关卡变得越来越复杂，陆续出现了悬浮砖块，磁力砖块等等。不过这个游戏总的来说不是太难，是个相当休闲的游戏，并不需要燃烧掉太多的脑细胞。

游戏自2015年4月1号更新以来，Challenge n°1这个成就出了bug，无论如何都不能解锁，很多人反映了这个问题，但是制作人再也没关注过自己的这个游戏，所以看起来以后也不会修复了，想要拿全成就只能靠sam了。

21760763.review: Довольно приятная игра-головоломка. Сойдет, что бы убить несколько часов, когда глаза устали от графена HD игр и просто хочется успокоить мозги чем-то ненапрягающим. Очень годится в те моменты, когда ты уставший приходишь с работы и просто хочешь убить оставшееся время чем-то ненапряжным. Хотя если вы не любитель шевелить извилинами, то вам может и не понравиться игра. Но в целом очень даже милая игра.

Non adatto a coloro che non hanno pazienza o non cercano nel videogioco il ragionamento.

19223124.review:
Ubinota est un jeu de réflexion qui nous plonge dans un monde où les habitants vivent sur des îles faîtes de cubes flottants dans le ciel.
L’ambiance est apaisante, sereine, ultracolorée, parfait pour se poser devant un jeu intelligent. 
Les dialogues sont amusants, la musique est douce et zen.
Et si dans les premiers niveaux, tout est très simple, après ça se complique quand on doit créer plusieurs chemins de couleurs différentes ! 
Il semble y avoir une centaine de niveaux divisés en 7 mondes et chaque niveau est normalement plus compliqué que le précédent.

Lucien est un apprenti peintre qui vit dans son île paradisiaque.
Un magicien lui apprend alors qu’il faut aider les villageois à toujours rester connectés entre eux,
à l’aide d’une peinture magique. Dans le ciel, vous observez plusieurs structures faites de blocs blancs :
Vous devez alors peindre des cases de façon à relier toutes les petites maisons disponibles, 
la peinture empêchant les blocs de tomber du ciel.

C’est joli, c’est mignon, c’est zen, je prends beaucoup de plaisir à faire ce jeu, les amoureux de puzzle-games peuvent se jeter sur Ubinota !

I played it for maybe an hour before deciding it just wasn't for me, but I only got through the first world and a few levels of world 2, so keep in mind that it has a lot of levels to offer.

非常有意思的一款小游戏，画面精美有点萌，一开始看到主角的人设还觉得有点丑，看久了也没什么了。背景音乐也做得不错，加分。关卡设计很有意思，难度有难有简单，还穿插一些小剧情，感觉给小朋友玩都可以，或者说，这游戏可以锻炼小孩的创造能力。当然，大朋友玩起来就要多点小孩子的奇思妙想了。可是，成就里有一个bug无法达成，上网查了下修改了数据才能过了那成就。

18712220.review:
Ubinota is a great game. It offers challenging puzzles with a moderately increasing pace of difficulty, yet every puzzle is more fun than the one before it. The characters are funny and the art style is good. The music is relaxing and really suits the "floating islands in the sky" theme.


-You play as Lucien; a boy that repaints floating islands in the form of puzzles to save his people, with the help of a wizard, who creates these magical paints.

-This game combines puzzles with physics, as you have to balance cubes and islands in advanced levels, using various types of paint.

-Great relaxing music.

-Fair price for a must have in this genre.


I would definitely recommend this game to anyone who likes a challenging puzzle game with increasing difficulty, great music, and good physics.

18689916.review:
非常有趣的解謎遊戲，不需要很久的解謎過程，篇簡單但是還是需要動動腦袋，遊戲畫風充滿童趣
適合各年齡層的玩家，雖然沒有卡片可以收集!小小的缺點，bgm也很可愛，我推薦Ubinota!!!ㄏ勝!

18674256.review:
Awesome game :D

Pros:
- GREAT concept
- Some levels are quite challenging and require a special way of thinking (E.g. a 'hook' method or using the ghost paint)
- Many levels to choose from
- More difficult levels for the 'hardcore' puzzlers out there, which are easily spotted on the world-map thanks to a !-sign
- Interesting forms of paint (E.g. Ghost paint and yellow paint)

Cons:
- The same doesn't always happen when painting the same cubes, meaning that sometimes you will complete a level when painting a set of cubes, and sometimes you won't. (This especially happens when using the red paint)
- Achievement 'Challenge n1' is broken, you currently can't achieve it in a non-cheating way. (There however is a guide in French out there which helps to avoid this problem, by changing something in the game's files. (There are plenty of pictures there so you don't need to speak French in order to understand the guide)).
- Annoying main character. I personally hated some of Lucien's conversations, which almost always end up in "I'm hungry","I'm sleepy" or something else which combines the two of them.
- Sometimes translated not so well. So sometimes I wasn't able to understand some of the English from the game because the sentences just didn't make sense.

Overall:
I really liked the puzzle-aspect of the game, despite some of the bugs, unclear things or annoying main character.

Awesome puzzle game.
Haven't seen such a nice puzzle for a long time.
And it has a very unique puzzle concept. It is reeeeally fun to play.

The goal is to paint the block in such a way so that the houses doesn't fall.
There are six kind of paint which make the game more fun.

All levels are well made and entertaining.

And it comes with a well made story. There aren't many puzzle games come with story.

The bad is...

Unfortunately it doesn't have trading cards. I hope they will add it in the future.

18620505.review: 游戏很不错，休闲游戏，有点智商要求，值得玩一下

18606647.review:
Неплохая, в целом, головоломка, которую можно пройти за пару-тройку вечеров. Красим кубики различными красками, обычно с разными физическими свойствами, задача не дать упасть домикам вниз. Задачи вменяемой сложности: на основных уровнях, обычно, всё просто, а на продвинутых (где, зачастую нужно думать Out of the Box) заставляет напрячься. Впечатление от игры портят следующие моменты:
1. Затянутое начало. До появления специальных видов красок головоломки страдают крайним однообразием. Из их числа выделяются как раз продвинутые (с восклицательным знаком) уровни, которые учат нестандартным приёмам, которые очень пригодятся в будущем. Иными словами нужно перетерпеть Первый мир, дальше задачки будут намного интересней.
2. Недетерминированное поведение физики. Становится заметно, с появлением сложных в просчете задач (летающие кубы, при падении  объектов, нежесткая краска). Т.е. при одной и той же раскраске уровня результат может быть различным, и вести как к проигрышу, так и победе (например, баланс летающей платформы). В результате проиграть можно не потому, что решение не работает, а случайным образом.
3. Рестарт уровня с самого начала. Учитывая пункт 2, раздражает необходимость перекрашивать весь уровень заново. Поначалу это не кажется проблемой, но ближе к концу, когда требуется сделать много действий, реально напрягает.
4. Сохранение прогресса в папку с игрой. Казалось бы, мелочь, но верификация установки, встроенная в Steam, затирает ВЕСЬ прогресс.
5. Сломанное, после обновление, достижение. Автор переделал один из уровней, в результате чего ачивка стала недостижимой. 
Последние два пункта чисто технические, и, казалось бы, при желании их легко исправить, но за несколько месяцев автор Ubinota не удосужился проявить интерес к проблемам Steam-версии.
Как итог, если вас не беспокоят эти нюансы, то игра должна оставить положительные эмоции. Ибо свои [b]7/10[/b] вполне отрабатывает.

18536466.review:
游戏不错，趣味十足，某些关卡颇有难度，需要开拓思维来解答。

美工方面中等偏上，因为特效少，没有让人惊叹的画面。

这种游戏如果没有绚丽的画面和独特的风格，就无法让人沉浸其中享受解密的乐趣，很快就会腻。

也不能太难，会玩不下去，就像RUSH那样。

这款游戏的难度刚刚好，在各种趣味关卡中穿插一个脑细胞终结关。

属于那种，一路通关，伴随着简单的剧情。
简单的关卡嫌简单：呵，太简单了吧。
难的关卡也不算难：呵，就这样？
但是遇到脑细胞终结关，卡关了就会抓破头，在电脑前呻吟：啊啊啊啊，这鬼玩意到底怎么过嘛~~！
最后终于通过了会惊呼：卧槽！竟然还能这样_(:з」∠)_。

那个feel，你自己来感受吧。

18511289.review: Fun and relaxing game. I'd say it's worth playing :)

18510219.review:
Очень интересная игра, по началу легенькая, но потом все труднее и труднее, бывают уровни где сидишь и тупишь, не понимаешь, думаешь "ДА ЧТО ХОЧЕТ ОТ МЕНЯ ЭТА ИГРА, КАК МНЕ ЭТО СДЕЛАТЬ?")) но когда въезжаешь понимаешь что ты умничка :D
 *Плюсы:
+интересные уровни
+растущее количество разносвойственных красок)
+приятные, яркие, но не напрягающие цвета
+довольно приятная рисовка, не как в Child of Light или в играх Daedalic Entertainment конечно)), но для такой инди игры где упор на логику вполне хорошо!)
+хорошая музыка, меняется из уровня в уровень и даже слушая с 2 компьютеров оставалось приятной)
 *Минусы:
- на уровне легчайшие задания перемешаны с более менее трудными, и после трудных очень скучно легкие делать, и так на каждом уровне, в легких начинаешь искать подвохи какие то но там просто из точки в точку провести нужно)
- вылетает иногда, правда все сохраняется но вылетела раза 3-4
- руссификации истории нету, поэтому я не знаю что там мальчик с этими людьми делал)

18483405.review: Proposta muito interessante! Com um visual bonito e divertido, Ubinota faz com que o jogador tenha que usar sua capacidade de observação e raciocínio lógico. Ótimo para passar um tempo e fortemente recomendado para crianças e adolescentes.

18483056.review:
Just a brilliant 3D Puzzle game. Over 100 levels of fun. A dreamy soundtrack. Nice cubicle graphics. And lots of thinking. Use different paints with special abilities (red for floating, gold for floodfill, green for elastic and blue for solid blocks) They are being unlocked during the game and make the puzzles sometimes even harder.
But it's still fun. First you paint the blocks then you push the button and you see immediatly the result. Sometimes you must use the different colored blocks as hooks or bolts. The exclamation sign (!) levels are extra hard. Aim is to prevent the houses falling into the abyss.

Besides some little bugs (a gamecache verify caused a savegame wipe and the last update made an achievement broken) is Ubinota a very good game.

18483021.review: I like this game ^^  very very very very much!!!!!!!!!!!

18481799.review: 其实就是连接方块的游戏，零难度比较适合女生玩

18255112.review:
This is a fascinating puzzle game that is partially undermined by a middling user interface and missing feature.

The concept is creative - paint blocks to anchor houses and keep them from falling out of the sky.  There are different blocks with different abilities (red ones float, green ones are bendy, etc.), and you have a limited amount of each color.  The puzzles start out fairly easy, but quickly become mind-bending.  I was able to solve all but one on my own; unfortunately I'm not seeing a guide to get me past that one, although it's thankfully a bonus. 
The game is strong, but it could be better with one thing: the ability to step back to just before you tested your solution so you don't have to redo every puzzle from scratch every attempt. That probably added an hour to the 5 hours it took me to finish. Without that frustration, the ability to experiment more freely would greatly improve the game.  The ambiance and story are cute, the puzzles creative and always providing new twists. If it were just a little more friendly to the player, it would be perfect, instead of just very good. (also, the physics of the drop seem to be a little random; sometimes doing the exact same thing twice would have completely different results. A little annoying, but not too bad).

18092208.review:
バランスブロックパズルゲーム。
ブロックをペンキで塗ることによってつながることを利用して、ブロックの上に載っているオブジェクトを落下させないようにしていくパズルゲームだ。
ゲーム性は橋建設ゲームに近い。手前の赤いボタンを押すと柱ブロックにつながっていないブロックは落下してしまう。基本的に落下させないようにするにはブロックに柱ブロックと同じ色を塗って同じ色のブロック同士を柱ブロックまでつないでいく必要があるが、場合によっては直接つなぐことなく他のブロックでバランスを取って支えるといった方法でのクリアも可能だ。
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=520053296 http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=520053316
ゲーム途中からは、ペンキの色が増え様々な効果を持ったブロックを使うことが出来る。例えば、赤色ペンキはブロックを浮かせることができる、黄色ペンキは同じ色の隣接ブロックを一気に塗りつぶすことができるといった具合だ。

残念なことは、物理演算を利用しているためにクリア判定は微妙なときがあり、後半のステージに行くほど「これでクリアはいいのか？」と思ってしまう状態でクリアできてしまうことがある。一部のステージでは同じ方法で同じ結果が得られないこともある。
しかし、最初は戸惑うかもしれないがルール自体はシンプルで慣れれば面白いゲームだ。難易度はそこそこでステージ数は100以上あり、ちょっとした頭の体操には良いパズルゲームだと思う。

16609428.review:
[H1]"Paint the blocks and they don't drop" [/H1]
Just a brilliant 3D Puzzle game. Over 100 levels of fun. A dreamy soundtrack. Nice cubicle graphics. And lots of thinking. Use different paints with special abilities (red for floating, gold for floodfill, green for elastic and blue for solid blocks) They are being unlocked during the game and make the puzzles sometimes even harder.
But it's still fun. First you paint the blocks then you push the button and you see immediatly the result. Sometimes you must use the different colored blocks as hooks or bolts. The exclamation sign (!) levels are extra hard. Aim is to prevent the houses falling into the abyss.

Besides some little bugs (a gamecache verify caused a savegame wipe and the last update made an achievement broken) is Ubinota a very good game.

15963800.review:
It's an okay problem solving game, but it seems that certain achievements are literally impossible unless cheating. Devs have changed the levels and paint amount so you can't get all of them. After some levels, certain challenges are impossible to do the normal way and require you to find the right combination of blocks with physics.. and solving the challenges that way doesn't seem very realistic. Blocks should be falling without support, but somehow a group of blocks can stay balanced even if supported by a single block under it (on the side or where ever)

7.5/10

Edit 10/13/2015 - Changing to "Not Recommended" because achievements are outdated, gameplay is boring overall and certain levels are very frustrating to figure out because of physics.

15958838.review:
공간지각력을 바탕으로 한 퍼즐 게임.

색칠한 블록들은 아래로 낙하하지 않는다. 이를 바탕으로 블록들 위에 있는 집들을 떨어지지 않도록 잘 색칠하는 것이 이 게임의 목적. 더불어 툰렌더링으로 만들어진듯한 게임의 그래픽도 나쁘지 않은 편이다. 하늘을 바탕으로 한 데다가 전반적으로 게임의 분위기도 느긋한 편이라 편안하게 플레이할 수 있다.

각 색깔 페인트의 특성과 중력의 특성만 제대로 이해하고 있으면 게임도 전부 풀린다. 겉보기엔 꽤나 어려운 게임으로 보일 수 있겠지만, 침착하게만 플레이한다면 어지간해선 전부 풀릴만한 난이도이다. 공간지각력이 출중한 플레이어라면 이 게임도 더욱 쉽게 할 수 있을 것이다. 

다른 색 페인트는 다 괜찮은데, 빨간 페인트과 초록 페인트의 움직임은 조금 납득하기 힘들다. 결합이 약한 초록색 페인트은 어찌어찌 퍼즐을 풀어나갈 수 있겠다만, 특히나 공중에 뜨는 빨간 페인트은 얘가 제자리에 떠있는게 아니라 이상하게 공회전을 해대기 때문에 생각이 꼬이는 경우가 상당히 많다. 이를 통해 득보는 상황도 가끔 있긴 하지만, 보통 손해보는 상황이 훨씬 많기 때문에 문제가 되는 부분. 게임을 전부 클리어한 지금도 빨간 페인트의 움직임은 제대로 이해를 못 하겠다.

옵션이 대단히 부실한 게임이기도 한데, 일단 창모드가 아예 안 되는 것으로 확인된다. 스팀 시작 옵션을 활용하지 않는다면 무조건 게임을 전체화면으로 할 수밖에 없다. (스팀 시작 옵션 켜도 창모드가 되는진 모르겠다. 안 해봐서...) 게다가 최적화가 제대로 안됐는지 게임을 오래 플레이하다보면 게임이 툭툭 끊긴다. 심하면 튕기기도 하고.

정육각형 블록들을 바탕으로 한 공간지각형 게임이라는 컨셉이 재밌었던 게임이다. 퍼즐 게임 좋아한다면 꽤나 재미있게 즐길 수 있을 게임. 빨간 페인트의 괴상망측한 움직임만 어떻게 좀 했으면......

http://blog.naver.com/kitpage/220372692012

14747453.review:
My Quick Look of Ubinota:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TgNi0Xj73ho

The story is there is a civilization in the clouds, made possible by using paint that can fix the clouds in space. As the levels progress you're given more and more types of paint colors that need to properly anchor to the correct fixed clouds.  

It's almost like solving multiple mazes in a 3D space.  Extremely relaxing and zen-like.  Well executed.

14745845.review:
In this installment of Indie Investigations, we take a look at Ubionta by Rota Team. It's a puzzle game, and as such I spend a lot of this video frustrated. Artwork is okay, music is very zen, but the gameplay leaves a little to desired. My verdict: It's okay. Watch the video and find out why!
